ai_summary: Simple RSA encryption bypassed using modular inverse to compute the private
  key
ai_tags:
- rsa
- mod-inv
- brute
created: 2024-11-30T17:04
points: 50
solves: 405
updated: 2024-12-08T01:43
---

Very simple RSA (not RSA).

```python
from secret import flag
from Crypto.Util.number import bytes_to_long, getPrime

flag = bytes_to_long(flag)
p = getPrime(2048)
q = getPrime(2048)
c = pow(flag, p, q)  # i believe this is the fancy rsa encryption?
print(f'{p=}')
print(f'{q=}')
print(f'{c=}')
```

## solve

$$
\begin{align}
1 & \equiv pk\pmod{q} \\
k & \equiv p^{-1}\pmod{q} \\
(x^p)^k & \equiv x^{p\cdot p^{-1}}\equiv x\pmod{q}
\end{align}
$$

```python
from sympy import mod_inverse

from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes
p = 
q = 
c = 
mod_inv = mod_inverse(p, q-1)
a = pow(c, mod_inv, q)
print(long_to_bytes(a))
```

```flag
wwf{ju57_u53_l1br4r135}
```
